definition: Ordinary written language without the metrical structure of verse, organized in sentences and paragraphs

positive_examples: Prose is the ordinary form of written language, without meter or line breaks.
Prose encompasses fiction (novels, stories) and nonfiction (essays, journalism).
Prose poetry occupies the boundary: poetic intensity in prose format.
Good prose has rhythm too, just not regular metrical patterns.
training_hints.disambiguation: Sentence-and-paragraph writing as distinct from verse, not just any text
